title: How to translate a book and publish it - Quora

response.answer_text: First you have to buy the right to translate it into the desired language. This can be obtained from the rights department of the original publisher; if they don't have the rights they will direct you to the author or agent. If you are envisioning a commercial publication, it can help to approach the publisher in your destination language, who may give you an advance and help acquire the rights. Grants are also often available from institutions in the original language, especially from European languages into English.

You begin by contacting the publisher and asking how much it would cost to license a foreign edition in your country or language (ideally both). Then you evaluate the feasibility of success at that cost. Then you’d work to translate and announce the work for publication, identifying where it would be sold and of interest.
